intro: Corchorus sidoides, commonly known as the African sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it often grows in disturbed soils. Corchorus sidoides is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
